alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Jefferson; Pottawatomie; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 12:39AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Jefferson, Shawnee, northeastern Wabaunsee, southeastern Pottawatomie and southern Jackson Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1239 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Belvue to near Paxico to 7 miles south of Alma. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Topeka, Rossville, St. Marys, Dover, Silver Lake, Meriden, Hoyt, Maple Hill, Mayetta, Paxico, Delia, Willard and Keene. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 333 and 355. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 176 and 183. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas.
